intro: Cyrtandra paludosa var. honopueensis, commonly known as the Honopu endemic cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant is often found in wetland or swampy habitats, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it plays a significant role in the ecological diversity of its native region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
